messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where º Uº R???
messages.msgSnippet: OHHHHHHHHHHH JOHNNNNNNNNNNnnnnn, did you HAVE TO BRING *THAT* UPPPPPPPPP??? *arrgh* ... NOPE, we don t EVER have any rain, either!!!   actually when it DOES
messages.messageBody:
OHHHHHHHHHHH JOHNNNNNNNNNNnnnnn, did you HAVE TO BRING *THAT* UPPPPPPPPP???
*arrgh* ... NOPE, we don't EVER have any rain, either!!! actually when it
DOES rain the kids run outside and say "HEY MOM WHAT IS THAT???"
nooooo-hahas ... however, WHEN IT DOES RAIN, we have GULLEY WASHERS, don't
we??? ... Oct 98 all of south TX was washed out to the Gulf of MX and June
21, 97 (dd's wedding day) SA had 14 inches of RAIN, thankfully dd changed
her mind about having her reception OUTDOORS ...

Pris ~> who'z SICK of rationing water, tired of wilted plants/ferns and
crunchy grass :L
WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...

----- Original Message -----
From: "Lynda" <lurine@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 10:38 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] how hot is it where ºUº R???
>
> Well, not to make it too terrible for ya, Pris, but we live in an area
that
> has the average temp for the whole U.S. which means it runs about 67
> degrees all year. We only vary by about 10 degrees in either direction
and
> only have about a dozen frost days a year. The little town "next door"
has
> the most growing days in a year for the whole country.
>
> However, we can usually drive down the road a bit (half hour to an hour)
> and be in some friendly (80 to 90's) heat in one direction and serious
heat
> (90's and up) in the other. But, this year we didn't get the "friendly"
> heat to often on the river which was a disappointment to the kidlets.
>
> And going up the hill to the hotter temps was kinda limited as last year
we
> lost 100,000 acres to a fire compliments of the parks boozos and one of
> their controlled burns.
>
> Lynda
